title: Are we responsible for our actions and philosophy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Just like dreams are series of thoughts, images, and sensations occurring in a person’s mind during sleep, humanity is in a state called “The Sleeping Humanity”. A state where everyone depicts to itself the reality he or she lives in, presently humanity projects to itself a false world called the dream world driven by “EGO”. Human being receive sensations through our five senses, but something happens along the way, our ego concealed the true perception of reality from our senses, we receive sensation that as already been filtered by the mechanism called ego, to get out of this dilemma humanity must learn what the true perception of reality is, how to attained it, and what is expected of us to do in order to attained such sublime reality for the betterment of ourselves and the future generation to come.
Yes ,we are not only responsible for both our actions and philosophy but for your inactions and indifference behaviour .You cannot blame on others .
Are we responsible for our actions? Yes, both physically and morally. Are we responsible for our philosophy? More difficult, but as philosophy is one of the ways we explore our world, then yes.
